Findings: Purulent infection. Distal stent migrated to RMS. L main obstructed.

Plan: PACU. Cultures. Antibiotics.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Rigid bronchoscopy with removal of airway foreign bodies.
INDICATIONS: Complicated TE fistula with stent migration and presumed infection.
PROCEDURE: General anesthesia was induced. Initial flexible inspection revealed purulent secretions and a migrated tracheal stent occluding the left mainstem. A rigid bronchoscope was introduced. The airway was lavaged. Using rigid forceps, the migrated tracheal stent was grasped and extracted. Inspection revealed underlying mucosal inflammation but no active bleeding. The esophageal stent remained in place covering the fistula.

note_text:
Procedure: Stent Removal.
Attending: Dr. Gallegos.
Steps:
1. LMA/Flex scope check.
2. Rigid scope inserted.
3. Lavage of pus.
4. Migrated stent grabbed with rigid forceps.
5. Stent removed en bloc with scope.
6. Airway inspected - fistula covered by esophageal stent.
Plan: Nebs, cultures.

cpt_summary.description: Thoracoscopy, diagnostic, with or without pleural biopsy, with or without chest tube placement

bundling_notes: Pleural fluid drainage and indwelling catheter placement through the thoracoscopy access are included in 32601 and are not separately coded.
coding_review.rationale: The procedure is a medical thoracoscopy with extensive visual inspection, large-volume drainage of pleural effusion, and multiple pleural biopsies followed by tunneled pleural catheter placement. note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Medical Thoracoscopy and Indwelling Pleural Catheter Placement.
CLINICAL SUMMARY: Right-sided exudative effusion. 
FINDINGS: 1.6L serosanguinous fluid drained. Diffuse parietal and visceral nodules consistent with carcinomatosis. 
INTERVENTION: Twelve biopsies were taken. A PleurX catheter was tunneled and inserted under direct visualization. Post-procedure imaging confirmed catheter position.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with bronchial thermoplasty / bronchoscopic lung volume reduction (per lobe series)

bundling_notes: Rigid bronchoscopy used for assessment and transition to flexible therapeutic bronchoscopy is bundled into 31647.
coding_review.rationale: The note describes bronchoscopic lung volume reduction via thermal vapor ablation of RUL segments with deep sedation and fluoroscopic guidance. Internal BLVR mapping uses 31647 for bronchoscopic lung volume reduction. No valves, navigation, or EBUS are documented. Therefore, 31647 alone is appropriate.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Bronchoscopic Lung Volume Reduction via Thermal Vapor Ablation.
INDICATION: Heterogeneous RUL emphysema with collateral ventilation.
PROCEDURE: The RUL was catheterized. The InterVapor system was used to deliver thermal energy. 
TREATMENT: 
- Anterior segment (RB3): 8 calories.
- Apical segment (RB1): 6 calories.
Total energy 14 calories to a target volume of 10g. Vapor containment was confirmed fluoroscopically.

Bronchoscopy, each additional tracheobronchial stent or additional airway segment (add-on)

bundling_notes: Airway inspection, dilation, and debridement are considered inherent to complex stent placement and are not separately coded when performed in the same anatomic region.
coding_review.rationale: The case describes rigid bronchoscopy with placement of a silicone Y-stent for subglottic/tracheal stenosis with bilateral mainstem involvement. Documentation supports tracheal stent placement with additional segmental limbs, consistent with base code 31631 and add-on stent codes 31633 and 31637. No separate EBUS, navigation, or valve therapy is performed.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Rigid bronchoscopy with silicone Y-stent placement.
INDICATION: Critical central airway obstruction due to extrinsic compression.
PROCEDURE: The airway was secured with a rigid bronchoscope. Significant tracheal and carinal compression was noted. A 16x13x13 silicone Y-stent was customized and deployed. The tracheal, left, and right limbs were positioned to stent open the carina. Post-deployment inspection confirmed restored patency.

note_text:
OPERATIVE NOTE: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical and thermal tumor destruction.
FINDINGS: Multiple polypoid lesions obstructing the subglottic trachea.
PROCEDURE: The large lesions were resected using an electrocautery snare. The tumor base was treated with Argon Plasma Coagulation (APC). Excellent luminal restoration was achieved. Stent placement was discussed but deferred per patient preference.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (add-on)
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial needle aspiration(s), trachea, main stem, and/or lobar bronchus (single lobe/station)
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(ies), single lobe
Bronchoscopy, diagnostic, with bronchoalveolar lavage
Bronchoscopy with bronchial occlusion (e.g., balloon/Chartis) for assessment of collateral ventilation

bundling_notes: 31627 is appropriately reported as an add-on to the diagnostic and sampling bronchoscopy codes when computer-assisted navigation is used.

NCCI edits apply between certain biopsy and TBNA combinations in the same lobe; the registry warning about 31628 + 31629 is acknowledged, but both are retained because the documentation supports both lung biopsy and needle aspiration sampling.
coding_review.rationale: The 2/11/2025 Ion procedure includes navigational bronchoscopy to an RUL lesion, TBNA sampling, transbronchial lung biopsy, BAL, and Chartis collateral ventilation testing. Navigation (31627) is correctly coded as an add-on to the diagnostic/sampling codes. 31628 and 31629 capture the parenchymal lung biopsy and TBNA respectively, 31624 captures BAL, and 31634 captures the Chartis physiologic assessment. No BLVR valve placement is performed in this session.

evidence.primary_indication: INDICATION FOR OPERATION:  Logan Pierce MRN: 62481955 is a 76 year old-year-old male chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and a right upper lobe (RUL) nodule.  The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.  Patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed. CONSENT : Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient or surrogate read and signed the provided consent form / provided consent over the phone. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule J44.9 COPD POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS:  R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule J44.9 COPD

follow_up_plan: Await path and culture results and based on findings f/u for EBV insertion for COPD

code_rationales.31634: Chartis assessment of LUL (distinct lobe from biopsies).

coding_review.overall_assessment: Complex bronchoscopy accurately coded. Chartis allowed as it targeted a different lobe (LUL) than the biopsies (RUL).

changes: Corrected BLVR fields (LUL target for Chartis); Added coding_review.
warnings: NCCI bundling: 31628 + 31629 - TBLB and TBNA same lesion. Consider modifier -59/-XS if distinct sites.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (add-on)
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial needle aspiration(s), trachea, main stem, and/or lobar bronchus (single lobe/station)
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(ies), single lobe
Bronchoscopy, diagnostic, with bronchoalveolar lavage
Bronchoscopy with bronchial occlusion (e.g., balloon/Chartis) for assessment of collateral ventilation

bundling_notes: 31627 is appropriately reported as an add-on to the diagnostic and sampling bronchoscopy codes when computer-assisted navigation is used.

NCCI edits apply between certain biopsy and TBNA combinations in the same lobe; the registry warning about 31628 + 31629 is acknowledged, but both are retained because the documentation supports both lung biopsy and needle aspiration sampling.
coding_review.rationale: The 2/11/2025 Ion procedure includes navigational bronchoscopy to an RUL lesion, TBNA sampling, transbronchial lung biopsy, BAL, and Chartis collateral ventilation testing. Navigation (31627) is correctly coded as an add-on to the diagnostic/sampling codes. 31628 and 31629 capture the parenchymal lung biopsy and TBNA respectively, 31624 captures BAL, and 31634 captures the Chartis physiologic assessment. No BLVR valve placement is performed in this session.

Indication: Persistent air leak (RUL).
Proc: Valve placement.
Complication: Tension PTX.
Action: Emergency chest tube placed. Stabilized. Additional valve placed RB3.
Result: Air leak reduced. PTX managed.

code_rationales.31647: Placement of valves in RUL (RB1 and RB3). Chartis/balloon assessment (31634) removed as note does not document separate assessment work distinct from valve placement.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Removed 31634 (not supported); 31647 captures the valve placement.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with bronchial occlusion/Chartis assessment
Bronchoscopy with endobronchial valve placement / bronchial thermoplasty

bundling_notes: Internal rules and NCCI edits flag 31634 + 31647 in the same target lobe. The existing registry warning appropriately notes that separate payment for Chartis may require distinct lobes or modifier -59/-XS depending on payer policy.
coding_review.rationale: Harold Johnsons case involves a BLVR procedure for persistent air leak with documented Chartis collateral ventilation assessment followed by placement of Zephyr valves in RUL segments. Both Chartis (31634) and valve placement (31647) are documented. The combination is retained with awareness of bundling edits; final claim-level modifier decisions will depend on whether Chartis was performed in a distinct lobe or segment for the payer.

note_text:
OPERATIVE NOTE: Endobronchial valve placement for air leak management.
COMPLICATION: Following placement of the first valve in RB1, the patient developed a tension pneumothorax. A chest tube was emergently placed.
COURSE: Once stable, a second valve was placed in RB3. The air leak was reduced. The patient was admitted to ICU.

note_text:
Indication: LMS obstruction.
Proc: Rigid Bronch, Debulking, EBUS.
Action: EBUS-TBNA subcarinal. Rigid debulking LMS (APC/Cryo/Balloon). 50% improvement.
Note: Stent deferred.
Plan: Oncology/Radiation.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Lung mass with left main-stem obstruction

evidence.primary_indication: PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Lung mass with left main-stem obstruction

code_rationales.31641: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor (APC, cryo, electrocautery) in left mainstem.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Changed 31653 (3+ stations) to 31652 (1 station) based on documentation of only subcarinal sampling.

changes: Manual CPT adjustment: removed 31631 and 31633 because no airway stent was actually placed; retained 31641 and 31653 for tumor destruction and EBUS-TBNA.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with destruction of endobronchial lesion(s) (e.g., APC, electrocautery, cryotherapy)
Bronchoscopy with EBUS-guided transbronchial needle aspiration(s), 3 or more mediastinal/hilar lymph node stations

cpt_changes.reason: The Jacob Renfield note documents rigid bronchoscopy with EBUS-TBNA of a subcarinal mass and extensive APC/electrocautery/cryotherapy debulking of left mainstem tumor, but explicitly defers stent placement to a possible future procedure. 31631 and 31633 (therapeutic stent codes) are therefore not supported and have been removed.

bundling_notes: Diagnostic bronchoscopy, lavage, and inspection are inherent to 31641 and 31653.
EBUS-TBNA (31653) and therapeutic tumor destruction (31641) may both be reported when performed in the same session and distinct portions of the procedure are documented.
coding_review.rationale: This case combines EBUS-guided TBNA sampling of a subcarinal mass with subsequent rigid bronchoscopy for malignant left mainstem obstruction, using APC, electrocautery, cryotherapy, and balloon dilation to restore lumen. No airway stent is actually placed; the note instead discusses a future Y-stent if obstruction recurs. The appropriate coding is EBUS-TBNA of multiple stations (31653) plus therapeutic tumor destruction (31641). Stent placement codes are removed to align with the documented services.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Rigid bronchoscopy for malignant airway obstruction.
PROCEDURE: EBUS-TBNA was performed on the subcarinal station. Attention was turned to the obstructed left mainstem. Using rigid coring, APC, and balloon dilation, the airway was recanalized. No stent was placed at this time.
